article.name: KSAT Quiz Interactions Reports Overview
article.title: KSAT Quiz Interactions Reports Overview
article.body:
Quiz Interactions Reports are a Diamond subscription-level feature that includes information such as your users' quiz results and what answers they selected. This report can help you to identify trends such as commonly missed questions. You can use these insights to improve your training program. To learn more about Quiz Interactions Reports, see the sections below.

Enabling Quiz Interactions

Before you can create a Quiz Interactions Report, you need to first enable the setting.

  1. Log in to your KSAT console.
  2. Click your username in the top-right corner of the page, then select Account Settings.
  3. Navigate to Training > Training Settings.
  4. Enable the Track SCORM Interactions toggle
  5. Select a duration for storing quiz interaction data.

Creating A Report

You can create a Quiz Interactions Report in your KSAT console by navigating to Reports > Quiz Interactions Reports. For more information, see the screenshot and list below:

Note: It may take up to 24 hours for new campaign information to appear in this report.

  1. Report Type: Select Training Interactions by Purchased Course to see commonly missed questions by course. Or, select Training Interactions by Group to see commonly missed questions by group. Training Interactions by Group reports are calculated by dividing the sum of the individual group scores by the number of groups selected. Training Interactions by Purchased Course reports show individual scores grouped by different training content.
  2. Content: From this drop-down menu, select the training content you want to see the quiz results for.
  3. Attempt per Enrollment: Select First Attempt to see quiz results for the first attempt in a campaign enrollment or select Latest Attempt to see quiz results for the latest attempt in a campaign enrollment.
    Note:Attempts are based on campaign enrollment. Users enrolled in a course in multiple campaigns will have multiple First Attempts.
  4. Enrollment Language: From this drop-down menu, select the language you want to see the quiz results for.
  5. User Status: Select Active to see quiz results for users who are active in the console, or select Archived to see quiz results for users who are no longer active in the console and have been archived.
  6. Date Range: Select the date range you want to see quiz results for. You have the option to see quiz results for the last six months, last quarter, and more.

After you select your filters, click the Apply Changes button.

You can enable the View Question Details toggle on the right side of the page to see a detailed report on your users’ quiz selections.

The total percent correct is indicated by a blue percentage bar. Correct answers are indicated by a checkmark and a green percentage bar. Incorrect answers are indicated by a yellow percentage bar and will only appear if a user selected an incorrect answer.

images.alt:
This image displays a section of an administrative user interface for managing system settings, specifically focusing on "Training Settings."

**Left Navigation Pane (Sidebar):**

The sidebar lists configuration categories, with current and related sections visible:
*   **Account Information** (Blue, expandable/collapsed via down chevron)
    *   Purchased Products and Add-ons
    *   Account Privacy
    *   Organization Information
    *   Branding
    *   Placeholders
*   **User Management** (Blue, linkable/expandable via right chevron)
*   **Phishing** (Blue, linkable)
*   **Training** (Blue, expandable/collapsed via down chevron, indicating the active category)
    *   Training Settings (Selected, indented)
    *   Learner Experience (Indented, partially visible)

**Main Content Pane:**

This pane displays the configuration options for the selected "Training Settings" category.

*   **Header:** "Training" (Orange text), followed by "Training Settings" (Large black text).
*   **Configuration Toggles:** Three blue-and-white toggle switches are visible, all set to the **"On"** (enabled) position. Each toggle is associated with a setting label and a gray question mark icon (`?`) for help text.
    1.  **Add Content Surveys**
    2.  **Use Direct Links in Notifications**
    3.  **Track SCORM Interactions** (A large red arrow points directly to this third toggle switch.)
*   **Data Storage Setting:**
    *   **Label:** Select Quiz Interaction Data Storage Duration
    *   **Value:** 24 months (Displayed within an input field or selection box).

**Overall Context:**

The image documents the "Training Settings" configuration page, highlighting the active state of several training-related features, notably the enabled setting for "Track SCORM Interactions."

images.alt:
This image displays the filter configuration interface for the **Quiz Interactions Report**.

**Header and Actions:**
*   The primary report selected is **Training Interactions by Purchased Course**.
*   Action buttons in the upper right include an **Export as** dropdown and a dark gray **Save Report** button.

**Filters Section:**
The interface provides four primary filtering criteria:
1.  **Content (b):** Placeholder text reads "Select content..." (Dropdown).
2.  **Attempt per Enrollment (c):** Currently set to "Latest Attempt" (Dropdown). Includes a context help icon.
3.  **Enrollment Language (d):** Placeholder text reads "Select a language..." (Dropdown).
4.  **User Status (e):** Currently set to "Active" (Dropdown).

**Timeframe Section:**
The **Date Range (f)** filter is configured using three linked dropdown menus:
1.  Dropdown 1: **Preset Range**
2.  Dropdown 2: **Last 6 Months**
3.  Dropdown 3 (Timezone): **(GMT-04:00) Eastern Time (US & Canada)**

**Informational Note:**
A blue notification box at the bottom contains the text: **Note: New campaign information may take up to 24 hours to appear in this report.**
images.context: ampaign information to appear in this report.

images.alt:
This image displays a hierarchical scoring interface, likely for an educational or training assessment platform, under the heading **"Danger Zone."**

**A. Interface Controls (Top Right):**
A blue, enabled toggle switch labeled **"View Question Details"** is located in the upper right corner, indicating that detailed result views are currently active.

**B. Data Structure and Headings:**
The main content is structured with two primary columns: **"Questions"** and **"Percent Correct."** A question mark icon is associated with the "Percent Correct" heading, indicating a tooltip or help context.

**C. Question and Group Data (Example 1):**
The display shows a single question with multiple associated group results:

1.  **Question Title:** **"1. What should Dakota do?"**
2.  **Overall Result:** The summary score for "All Selected Groups" is **100 %**, visualized with a full-width blue progress bar.
3.  **Group Score (Accounting):**
    *   The "Accounting" group achieved a "Group Score" of **100 %** (blue progress bar).
    *   The specific answer detail: **"A. Do not log in. This feels too good to be true."** shows a result of $\checkmark$ **100 %**, visualized with a full-width green progress bar.
4.  **Group Score (IT):**
    *   The "IT" group achieved a "Group Score" of **100 %** (blue progress bar).
    *   The specific answer detail: **"A. Do not log in. This feels too good to be true."** shows a result of $\checkmark$ **100 %**, visualized with a full-width green progress bar.

**D. Visual Indicators:**
*   Blue progress bars indicate aggregated scores (Overall or Group Score).
*   Green progress bars and a green checkmark ($\checkmark$) indicate the score for a specific, correct answer selection.
*   All displayed percentage scores are 100%.
